TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(object sender, WebPartConnectionsEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed WebPartConnectionsEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(sender As Object, e As WebPartConnectionsEventArgs)
public delegate void WebPartConnectionsEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, WebPartConnectionsEventArgs ^ e);
type WebPartConnectionsEventHandler = delegate of obj * WebPartConnectionsEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: Objeto que contiene los datos del evento.
Docs.summary: Representa el método que controlará los eventos y del control .

remarks.format: ## Remarks El <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsEventHandler> clase define un delegado de controlador para dos eventos que se producen en el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control: el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnected> eventos y el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnected> eventos. El método que controla el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsConnected> evento es el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsConnected%2A> método. El método que controla el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartsDisconnected> evento es el <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.OnWebPartsDisconnected%2A> método. En ambos casos, los datos del evento se encuentran en un <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnectionsEventArgs> objeto.

Docs.related: Controles de elementos Web de ASP.NET
Introducción a las conexiones de elementos Web
